subject: Re: [junit] A basic Question about JUnit Installation
msgSnippet: ... The tests are not in junit.jar; they are loose class files inside one of the JUnit directories. ... 1. simpletest should be SimpleTest -- case matters. 2.
messageBody:
jiwenke2004 wrote:
> Hi
> I run the "java junit.textui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests" in
> the command line after set the CLASSPATH to the junit.jar,but it
> tells me :"Can not find the class of junit.samples.AllTests" ,What is
> wrong with my operation?

The tests are not in junit.jar; they are loose class files inside one of
the JUnit directories.

> And I'd like to run the samples in the installation directory such as
> simpletest, and specify the CLASSFILE to that simpletest.class and
> run "java junit.textui.TestRunner simpletest" it still tells me
> that :"Can not find the class of simpletest" What is wrong with
> that ?

1. simpletest should be SimpleTest -- case matters.
2. SimpleTest is in the package junit.samples, so you must call it
"junit.samples.SimpleTest" and not just "SimpleTest".

Take care.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
